title: core selector not working in Chrome
description:
after fresh installation of Solr 4.2 on windows 7 64bit
I do not see any cores in Google Chrome to select in combobox. Also - when trying to prepare URI by hand - I see error that there is no such core. In FireFox - there is default 'collection1' core visible without problems.

My Chrome version: 26.0.1410.28 beta-m
I cannot se any errors in JS console...

comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.content: I've seen this work on chrome in linux and osx as a data point.

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content: SOLR-4564 looks like it's the same issue.

comments.author: Stefan Matheis (steffkes)
comments.content: Maciej Lizewski Did you upgrade from an earlier version? If so, can you try to clear your browser-cache? We had this Thread on the list two weeks ago and that solved the Problem

comments.author: Maciej Lizewski
comments.content:
You were right. After clearing browser cache everything is working ok.
Sorry for duplicate issue - I search for something similar but did not found that one.

funny thing is that earlier I tried refreshing page with SHIFT which should reload all resources from server...

comments.author: Stefan Matheis (steffkes)
comments.content: Thanks for confirmation Maciej, i'll try to fix those caching-issues.
